001// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.
002// Open Source Software; you can modify and/or share it under the terms of
003// the WPILib BSD license file in the root directory of this project.
004
005package edu.wpi.first.hal;
006
007@SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
008public class REVPHFaults {
009  public final boolean Channel0Fault;
010
011  public final boolean Channel1Fault;
012
013  public final boolean Channel2Fault;
014
015  public final boolean Channel3Fault;
016
017  public final boolean Channel4Fault;
018
019  public final boolean Channel5Fault;
020
021  public final boolean Channel6Fault;
022
023  public final boolean Channel7Fault;
024
025  public final boolean Channel8Fault;
026
027  public final boolean Channel9Fault;
028
029  public final boolean Channel10Fault;
030
031  public final boolean Channel11Fault;
032
033  public final boolean Channel12Fault;
034
035  public final boolean Channel13Fault;
036
037  public final boolean Channel14Fault;
038
039  public final boolean Channel15Fault;
040
041  public final boolean CompressorOverCurrent;
042
043  public final boolean CompressorOpen;
044
045  public final boolean SolenoidOverCurrent;
046
047  public final boolean Brownout;
048
049  public final boolean CanWarning;
050
051  public final boolean HardwareFault;
052
053  /**
054   * Gets whether there is a fault at the specified channel.
055   *
056   * @param channel Channel to check for faults.
057   * @return True if a a fault exists at the channel, otherwise false.
058   * @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the provided channel is outside of the range supported by
059   *     the hardware.
060   */
061  public final boolean getChannelFault(int channel) {
062    return switch (channel) {
063      case 0 -> Channel0Fault;
064      case 1 -> Channel1Fault;
065      case 2 -> Channel2Fault;
066      case 3 -> Channel3Fault;
067      case 4 -> Channel4Fault;
068      case 5 -> Channel5Fault;
069      case 6 -> Channel6Fault;
070      case 7 -> Channel7Fault;
071      case 8 -> Channel8Fault;
072      case 9 -> Channel9Fault;
073      case 10 -> Channel10Fault;
074      case 11 -> Channel11Fault;
075      case 12 -> Channel12Fault;
076      case 13 -> Channel13Fault;
077      case 14 -> Channel14Fault;
078      case 15 -> Channel15Fault;
079      default -> throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException("Pneumatics fault channel out of bounds!");
080    };
081  }
082
083  /**
084   * Called from HAL to construct.
085   *
086   * @param faults the fault bitfields
087   */
088  public REVPHFaults(int faults) {
089    Channel0Fault = (faults & (1 << 0)) != 0;
090    Channel1Fault = (faults & (1 << 1)) != 0;
091    Channel2Fault = (faults & (1 << 2)) != 0;
092    Channel3Fault = (faults & (1 << 3)) != 0;
093    Channel4Fault = (faults & (1 << 4)) != 0;
094    Channel5Fault = (faults & (1 << 5)) != 0;
095    Channel6Fault = (faults & (1 << 6)) != 0;
096    Channel7Fault = (faults & (1 << 7)) != 0;
097    Channel8Fault = (faults & (1 << 8)) != 0;
098    Channel9Fault = (faults & (1 << 9)) != 0;
099    Channel10Fault = (faults & (1 << 10)) != 0;
100    Channel11Fault = (faults & (1 << 11)) != 0;
101    Channel12Fault = (faults & (1 << 12)) != 0;
102    Channel13Fault = (faults & (1 << 13)) != 0;
103    Channel14Fault = (faults & (1 << 14)) != 0;
104    Channel15Fault = (faults & (1 << 15)) != 0;
105    CompressorOverCurrent = (faults & (1 << 16)) != 0;
106    CompressorOpen = (faults & (1 << 17)) != 0;
107    SolenoidOverCurrent = (faults & (1 << 18)) != 0;
108    Brownout = (faults & (1 << 19)) != 0;
109    CanWarning = (faults & (1 << 20)) != 0;
110    HardwareFault = (faults & (1 << 21)) != 0;
111  }
112}
